[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_constants.move] [Function: primary_type(), secondary_type(), both_type()] [Type Discrimination] With primary=0, secondary=1, both=2, if oracle selection logic uses simple numeric comparison instead of equality, could `type < secondary_type()` accidentally include primary oracles when only secondary is safe?
